unnormalised: Fintech in India, yaar! It’s like Bollywood and cricket had a baby, but instead of singing and sixes, it's all about UPI and loans that approve faster than you can say "chai." Remember waiting in lines at the bank? Now, you can get a loan of ₹50,000 sitting in your pajamas, all thanks to these tech geniuses. Gone are the days when your friendly neighborhood Baniya was the only loan shark in town! Seriously though, fintech is booming, and everyone wants a piece of the digital rupee pie.

unnormalised: But let's be real, the "fin" part is still a little, well, *finicky*. There's always that risk, isn’t it? Like, what happens if your Aadhar card gets hacked, and someone takes out a loan in your name to buy 1000 kilos of jalebis? Or worse, invest in crypto... Remember that one uncle who claimed to be a crypto expert last year? How’s he doing now? These apps promising 15% returns sound as tempting as free biryani, but bhai, proceed with caution. DYOR, as they say. Do Your Own Research!

unnormalised: And the jargon! It's enough to make your head spin faster than a ceiling fan in peak summer. "AI-powered robo-advisors," "blockchain-based lending platforms," "algorithmic trading"... Seriously, can someone just explain it to me like I'm five? Or, you know, like I'm your average aunty trying to figure out how to pay her electricity bill online. I swear, sometimes I miss the days of passbooks and pen-and-paper transactions. At least then I knew where my ₹500 was going!

unnormalised: The other thing is the sheer number of these fintech startups cropping up faster than mushrooms after the monsoon. Every other day, there's a new app promising to "revolutionize" personal finance, or "disrupt" the insurance industry. Good luck figuring out which one is legit and which one will vanish faster than a plate of samosas at a wedding. A lot of these companies are advertising 0% processing fee or something, so always do your research.

unnormalised: So, is fintech the future? Maybe. Probably. Hopefully, with a little less risk and a little less jargon. And please, someone invent a fintech app that automatically makes me chai. That's the real disruption we need. Imagine an AI-enabled kettle that uses blockchain technology to track the price of ginger, all while giving you personalized investment advice! Now THAT's the unicorn we’ve all been waiting for, no? Till then, I will just stick to paying via UPI.
